Module containing all criteria available for splitting.

class criteria.Criterion¶

Bases: object

Abstract base class for every criterion.

name = ''¶
classmethod select_best_attribute_and_split(tree_node)¶

Returns the best split found, according to the criterion.

class criteria.GainRatio¶

Bases: criteria.Criterion

Gain Ratio criterion. For reference see “Quinlan, J. R. C4.5: Programs for Machine Learning. Morgan Kaufmann Publishers, 1993.”.

name = 'Gain Ratio'¶
classmethod select_best_attribute_and_split(tree_node)¶

Returns the best attribute and its best split, according to the Gain Ratio criterion.

Parameters:tree_node (decision_tree.TreeNode) – TreeNode where we want to find the best attribute/split.
Returns:the best Split found.
Return type:criteria.Split
class criteria.GiniGain¶

Bases: criteria.Criterion

Gini Gain criterion. For reference see “Breiman, L., Friedman, J. J., Olshen, R. A., and Stone, C. J. Classification and Regression Trees. Wadsworth, 1984”.

name = 'Gini Gain'¶
classmethod select_best_attribute_and_split(tree_node)¶

Returns the best attribute and its best split, according to the Gini Gain criterion.

Parameters:tree_node (decision_tree.TreeNode) – TreeNode where we want to find the best attribute/split.
Returns:the best Split found.
Return type:criteria.Split
class criteria.InformationGain¶

Bases: criteria.Criterion

Information Gain criterion. For reference see “Quinlan, J. R. C4.5: Programs for Machine Learning. Morgan Kaufmann Publishers, 1993.”.

name = 'Information Gain'¶
classmethod select_best_attribute_and_split(tree_node)¶

Returns the best attribute and its best split, according to the Information Gain criterion.

Parameters:tree_node (decision_tree.TreeNode) – TreeNode where we want to find the best attribute/split.
Returns:the best Split found.
Return type:criteria.Split
class criteria.Split(attrib_index, splits_values, criterion_value)¶

Bases: tuple

Contains the information about a given split. When empty, defaults to (None, [], float(‘-inf’)).

attrib_index¶

Alias for field number 0

count(value) → integer -- return number of occurrences of value¶
criterion_value¶

Alias for field number 2

index(value[, start[, stop]]) → integer -- return first index of value.¶

Raises ValueError if the value is not present.

splits_values¶

Alias for field number 1

class criteria.Twoing¶

Bases: criteria.Criterion

Twoing criterion. For reference see “Breiman, L., Friedman, J. J., Olshen, R. A., and Stone, C. J. Classification and Regression Trees. Wadsworth, 1984”.

name = 'Twoing'¶
classmethod select_best_attribute_and_split(tree_node)¶

Returns the best attribute and its best split, according to the Twoing criterion.

Parameters:tree_node (decision_tree.TreeNode) – TreeNode where we want to find the best attribute/split.
Returns:the best Split found.
Return type:criteria.Split
